content.prompt:
One form of the genetic disorder lipodystrophy involves the lack of an enzyme that is required for the synthesis of triglycerides, a type of lipid. Triglycerides serve as an energy reserve in fat cells.

Which of the following best describes the most likely effect of lipodystrophy on cell function?

choices.label: There will be a decrease in phospholipids in cell membranes.
There will be a decrease in cholesterol in cell membranes.
There will be a decrease in fat storage in cells.
There will be a decrease in fatty acid synthesis in cells.

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
